cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 395 mi SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting north today, expected to turn north-northeast then northeast and accelerate toward the northwest Florida Big Bend, then cross northern Florida and move off the Southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend between Anclote River and Indian Pass

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Marineland FL to Altamaha Sound GA under Tropical Storm Watch; Anclote River to Indian Pass under Hurricane Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Anclote River to Walton/Bay County line under Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast of Florida, then coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible (20–30 mph) late Thu–Fri
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side near Palm Beach
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain Thu–Fri
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low but non-zero risk of an isolated tornado in outer rain bands
